topic.title: best internet browser

topic.title: Ban users

1614539923_13rk7ENn3AgdqRXgeGQozHD5TGQQC.body:
> [jeff](#comment_94_1JFfyAT1DysW4LbK6WRd2szDoPjWgb22NT): Open Vivaldi's settings and click the Privacy tab. There are a dozen or more Google (dis)services enabled by default.

i have seen, and i have uncheck most of them. On chrome im not sure u can desactivate those

> [styromaniac](#comment_2989_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): GNOME Web is a good one. [...]

firefox is not anymre what it use to be

> [boot13](#comment_20_1PxMvud9KvbqaSZnV4piygA6dFTASwapHY): I'm not sure what you meant by 'degoogled', but are you aware that Vivaldi uses the Chromium browser engine? Chromium is maintained by Google. On the other hand, there's this official statement from Vivaldi: "In short, as it’s unable to get any data from Vivaldi users, Google does not benefit from Vivaldi being based on Chromium."

i know all of that. i just wanted a browser withoutending freedata to google about things they shouldnt be aware just if i go on wikipédia

> [transcoder](#comment_24_15q24B3R72uWT1UwtRMdFDmm3VXKcKVSiH): i like librewolf because it gives all the features of firefox, most importantly the addon support, while being insanely hardened right out of the box.

I  just know modern browse have way to many flaw regardding security. Like with webrtc u can patch nearly all of this but it s hard after to make some website work. i dont know if it s concerning i just know privacy is a right and god thank foss it will be hard without them

> [calmdownholden](#comment_19_17acbn9sNyYyLJrLfSz3KJxqonKZtgVxCD): I don't trust any browser that is "privately" owned and doesn't have an opensource counterpart.The larger the company, the more whistleblowing eyes there are.Yes, large companies are often corrupt as well, but I the numbers game over "good faith" claims any day.Statistics are always more reliable than faith and intuition.

when i use vivaldi i compile it from open source but it s a good point. I nowbasc of programing but i have no clue if vivaldi respect my orivacy but i think i trust people on internet before the internet or the social media dollars

Zeronet have big software flaw and it s not tottaly the best it can be, one time on a zite for musicc i have upload 2000 song in 3 sec and nobody can acess them because m no google, they have to download th db with my zic an an forgotten account, also the software havent any significant update since long time But i love the idea and i will suport it. I have join several time and it s always quite the same activty overall i say. Also it s mainly depends on your regions or connection so maybe u haventall seen ? But i do think the base idea is quite genious, if u base all software and hardware interaction with this sytem u could have your smartwatch only syncing to your phone and u should authorizate for wifi, or other stuff like that but i think the idea is quite genius
